snippet: The former New York City lab worker said she had been unaware there were questions regarding her handling of DNA evidence in hundreds of rape cases.
abstract: Serrita Mitchell, former New York City laboratory technician whose work on hundreds of rape cases is now being scrutinized for serious mistakes, denies she had resigned in 2011 under pressure; disclosure of the faulty examination of evidence is prompting questions about outside review of the medical examiner's office and potential lawsuit from the Legal Aid Society.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and NINA BERNSTEIN

lead_paragraph: The former New York City lab worker said she had been unaware there were questions regarding her handling of DNA evidence in hundreds of rape cases.

headline.seo: Former Lab Technician Denies Faulty DNA Work in Rape Cases

keywords.value: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of the City of New York
keywords.name: organizations
